articles.title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year
articles.description:
McDaniels took the Patriots from one of the worst offenses in the league, to one of the best, in one season.

The post Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Josh McDaniels transformed the Patriots' offense from worst to one of the best in one season.
McDaniels received the AP Assistant Coach of the Year award on February 5, 2026.
His success boosts local pride and expectations for the upcoming Patriots season.

articles.title: Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice
articles.description:
Robert Spillane was a limited participant during Thursday's practice, but Harold Landry didn't take the field.

The post Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane participated limitedly in practice on February 2.
Seahawks defensive starter Harold Landry did not practice at all on the same day.
Injuries may affect game strategies for the upcoming Super Bowl LX in Boston.

articles.title: Freight train derails in Connecticut, sending cars carrying liquid propane into river
articles.description:
Local and state officials said the derailment happened around 9 a.m. in Mansfield, near where Eagleville Lake meets the Willimantic River. The rural town in the eastern part of the state is home to the University of Connecticut.

The post Freight train derails in Connecticut, sending cars carrying liquid propane into river appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Freight train derailed in Mansfield, Connecticut, around 9 a.m. on February 5.
Several cars carrying liquid propane fell into the Willimantic River near Eagleville Lake.
Local officials are monitoring potential environmental impacts on the river and surrounding areas.

articles.title: NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists
articles.description:
The man was allegedly involved in three separate heists, stealing frozen snow crabs, blueberries, and designer cologne.

The post NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: A New York man stole $325K in seafood from a Worcester warehouse.
The theft involved frozen snow crabs, blueberries, and designer cologne.
Local seafood prices may rise due to increased thefts impacting supply.

articles.title: Loaded with trash talk and talent, the Patriots’ D-line might be the crew that wins Super Bowl LX
articles.description:
"Doesn't matter who it is, whoever on the field, just another day for the line to kick a--.”

The post Loaded with trash talk and talent, the Patriots’ D-line might be the crew that wins Super Bowl LX appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots' D-line shows confidence ahead of Super Bowl LX on February 12, 2026.
Milton Williams and Christian Barmore lead a talented defensive line for the team.
Strong performance could significantly boost Boston's pride and local fan engagement.

articles.title: Man pleads guilty to Snapchat hacking targeting Northeastern students
articles.description:
Kyle Svara was hired by a former Northeastern coach to hack the Snapchat accounts of women to obtain nude or semi-nude images.

The post Man pleads guilty to Snapchat hacking targeting Northeastern students appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Kyle Svara pleaded guilty to hacking Snapchat accounts of Northeastern students.
Svara was hired by a former Northeastern coach for this illegal activity.
This case raises concerns about student privacy and safety on campus.

articles.title: The Patriots’ Jack Gibbens went viral for his interview with a reporter born without legs. Dave Stevens’s story is deeper than that.
articles.description:
Stevens, the only person to play college football with no legs, is at the Super Bowl opening doors and advocating for people with disabilities.

The post The Patriots’ Jack Gibbens went viral for his interview with a reporter born without legs. Dave Stevens’s story is deeper than that. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots' Jack Gibbens interviews Dave Stevens, a Super Bowl advocate for disability rights.
Stevens is the only player to compete in college football without legs.
Their story highlights accessibility issues for Boston residents with disabilities.

articles.title: Bad Bunny preaches unity, teases what to expect from Super Bowl LX halftime show
articles.description:
"I think [there is no] better dance than the one that comes from the heart."

The post Bad Bunny preaches unity, teases what to expect from Super Bowl LX halftime show appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bad Bunny emphasizes unity in his upcoming Super Bowl LX halftime performance.
The Super Bowl LX will take place on February 12, 2026, featuring the Patriots.
Boston residents can expect a vibrant cultural showcase during the halftime show.
